meanings.definition: Move hurriedly with short quick steps.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel scurried across the yard to hide its acorn.
meanings.sent2: She scurried to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse scurried around the kitchen looking for cheese.
meanings.sent4: The children scurried through the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent5: The ants scurried in a line, carrying food to their nest.

meanings.definition: (of a small animal or person) Run with quick light steps.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit scurried away when it heard a noise.
meanings.sent2: The children scurried around the garden, playing tag.
meanings.sent3: The puppy scurried after its tail, trying to catch it.
meanings.sent4: The cat scurried up the tree to escape the barking dog.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel scurried up the trunk, carrying a nut in its mouth.
